Pre-Game Insights: Georgia and Czechia both need a victory, making this a must-win game.
Czechia had a tough loss to Portugal but could struggle to switch to an offensive game plan against Georgia.
Georgia showed promise in their debut with a strong performance against Turkey.
Willy Sagnol’s men are good enough to make this a competitive game.
Georgia’s goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili is expected to be a key player in keeping the Czechs at bay.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is scheduled to start at 9:00 a.m. ET on June 22, 2024.
The match will take place at Volksparkstadion in Hamburg, Germany.
Weather conditions are expected to be cloudy and humid with temperatures in the high 60s.
